file_content.text: You have my gratitude. But my son is now Lord Grathan, and we must keep up appearances. Come and go furtively.
Yes, I sensed my husband's death. Lord Grathan is no more. What pleasure to think he suffered.
He got what he deserved.
His death was due.
I took no pleasure in killing him.
Meant nothing to me.
He didn't enjoy it. He screamed like a stuck kath hound.
That makes one of you.
Mother, what does this mean? Am I truly to become the master of this house?
You will wear his mask and assume his identity. But you are not yet ready to rule, my dear. The voice will be yours, but the words will be mine.
I have longed for my father's death and the chance to claim his power.
Yes, this is a great day. You have served us well, my new friend.
I didn't do it for you.
I had my reasons.
I don't care why you did it, as long as it's done.
Keep your thanks--where are my credits?
Pay me.
You promised me a powerful item.
Where's my reward?
Perhaps you could show your appreciation in a more personal manner.
[Flirt] Want to be friendly?
Aren't you the rogue?
You freed me from an inconvenient husband and put me in control of this house. Let me show you my appreciation. In private.
Whoa, wait one minute. You're not seriously considering this?
Any shuttleport in a storm, is that the kind of guy you are?
Vette, don't blow this out of proportion.
Relax.
Fine. Whatever you say... master.
Of course not, Vette. I was only joking.
I take it back.
Oh. Well, good.
So, we don't get to know one another better, after all? Ah well, easy come, easy go.
Yeah, that's exactly the kind of guy I am.
You got that right.
Well, then I guess I was beginning to get the wrong idea about you.
You have really terrible taste in women.
Keep your opinions to yourself.
Mind your business.
You should keep your hands to yourself, but it's your life.
Don't be such a child.
So immature.
Age has nothing to do with good taste. But do what you have to do.
Maybe I'll beat that insubordination out of you.
Do I have to shut you up?
No, no need. Far be it for me to attempt to instill standards.
You have really terrible timing, Twi'lek. Have a shock.
Shut up. [Shock Vette]
Yearrgh! I--I really hate that.
Now that we've cleared that up, all this talk is making me impatient.
Beelzlit, find something to do, will you? Your mother needs some privacy.
Yes, Mother.
And are you going to dismiss your Twi'lek?
Vette, leave us.
Yes.
Don't have to tell me twice. I'm out of here.
Wait outside, slave.
Yes.
I'm very thankful. You have no idea how thankful.
If you prefer.
I suppose so.
Well, I certainly prefer. Don't strain yourself.
She never leaves my side.
She stays.
You have got to be kidding me.
Well well well, whatever you say, it's your party.
All alone at last. Now then, let me demonstrate my appreciation.
Of all the things I've endured to gain power, this was one of the least unpleasant. You are always welcome in my chamber, friend.
The minute I leave, we are enemies again.
We're not friends.
Keep the door unlocked.
I might be back.
Where would the fun be in that?
You'll never see me again.
That was a one-time thing.
All in a day's work.
No problem.
That may be so, but you still have a mountain of credits coming to you.
I'm sure. Still, I offered you a special item as reward.
You are as sensible as you are potent.
You owe me your lives.
You're lucky.
We owe you a sum of credits as well, I believe.
Our lives, yes--and I promised you a special item.
I may be Sith and mistress of a renegade house in defiance of the Dark Council, but I'm a woman of my word.
Even that is an understatement.
For appearance sake, you'll still be unwelcome here. But today, my son and I have become your secret allies.
As soon as I leave, we are enemies again.
I'm not your friend.
I would expect nothing else.
Farewell. It's been a pleasure.
Goodbye, Lady.
It has been a pleasure. You fulfilled my wildest dream.
Be sure it remains a secret.
Yes, keep it quiet.
Have no fear. It would be disastrous for me if our secret were exposed.
Now leave me. I have much to do now that I control House Grathan.
Don't waste your time waiting for me to double-cross you. I'll be the happiest of all once you've murdered Lord Grathan.
Enough! It's clear we are not your match!
If we're to die, I must know--what have we done to deserve death?
It's not personal.
That's not the point.
If not, then perhaps you'll entertain another option.
I deal death to the deserving and undeserving.
Death is arbitrary.
Then perhaps I can persuade you to set your sights elsewhere.
You have fought your way into the inner sanctum of a powerful Sith Lord's stronghold.
I kill your son to wound your husband.
The son of Grathan must die.
Stop! You are more than a match for us!
Mother, if I am the target, save yourself. I don't want to see you die.
My son, you must not sacrifice yourself for anyone, not even me. You must endure at all costs.
Assassin, you've carved your way into the inner sanctum of Lord Grathan's compound, all to kill a boy?
You are a breath away from the master himself. Spare us, and I'll help you destroy Lord Grathan instead.
You reek of desperation.
You'd say anything.
I'm sure I do.
You want me to kill your husband? Aren't you the dutiful wife?
With a spouse like you....
I married Lord Grathan for power. It was a means to an end--now I want out.
I'm strong, but can't touch my husband. How long I've waited for someone to end his oppressive rule.
Grathan must live.
I can't kill him.
And so he shall. Just hear me out.
I'm listening.
A wicked plan is taking shape. Long ago, my husband was nearly beheaded--now, he cannot exist without his helmeted mask. Everyone knows this.
Kill Lord Grathan. My son will wear the mask and assume his mantle. He'll publicly rant that his son was murdered. No one will be the wiser.
What's in it for me?
What do I get?
In addition to appearing successful in your task, I'll reward you in either credits or an item of power--your choice.
I'll kill your husband for credits.
Give me credits.
I prefer a powerful item.
An item sounds good.
No amount is worth deceiving my master.
Forget it, you die. [Attack]
Fine, I'll kill the father instead.
All right.
Excellent. You won't regret it. Lord Grathan deserves to die.
With this passcard, you may enter Lord Grathan's secret chamber. You'll find him there.
After you've ended Lord Grathan's miserable existence, bring his masked helmet to me.
I'll return shortly.
Be sure there are no surprises when I return.
No tricks.
I'm certainly not interested in angering someone as lethal as you. Besides, you're doing me a great service.
Finally, I get to kill a Sith Lord.
I'm going to relish this.
I can see you are an ambitious one. You're a climber, like me.
Be wary of Lord Grathan. There are few as attuned to the dark side as he.
Um, I don't think I like the sound of that.
I don't negotiate. The boy dies!
No. [Attack]
Sorry, my orders are clear.
Not buying it. [Attack]
Those aren't my orders.
Not why I'm here. [Kill them]
Beelzlit, run!
No, Mother--if I am to die, I die alongside you!
Mother, a stranger approaches.
You don't know the half of it, kid.
I am Cellvanta Grathan! How dare you enter my son's room uninvited! Who are you?
I am doom.
Bad news.
Step aside, woman. I'm here for the boy.
I'm not here for you.
You'll have to kill me first. And while my son is still an acolyte, I am fully Sith.
My name won't matter when you're dead.
Your executioner.
You'll find I am not so easily intimidated. My son is still an acolyte, but I am Sith!
Then we have something in common, Cellvanta.
As am I.
Then may the Force give me the strength to defeat you.
I suppose I should be trembling.
You think that scares me?
Soon your corpse will be twitching.
Not for very much longer, you're not.
Only temporarily.
Beelzlit, take cover!
No, Mother--I stand at your side. Attack!
